review_blob:
Bottle. Aroma is dark chocolate with some sweetness and yeast. Appearance is a murky pink/bronze with loads of cream colored head. Taste is cherry over the top with chocolate hidden in there. Hardly tastes like a beer at all. Palate is straight syrup. Hides the alcohol well, though. Overall, swing and a miss. Sorry, Sam.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber bottle. Aroma is sweet fruit. Appearance is a reddish bronze with little head and some lacing. Taste is a sour red with a hint of smoke on the end. Palate is light and sour. Overall, an interesting beer. Would have liked to sort the fig out more.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Aroma is sour years and earthy, raw cherries. Appearance is murky brown with little head. Taste is sour with a hint of cherry and some dark, caramel malts. Palate is sour and light bodied. Overall, a good sour from Avery. Another example of how they do barrel aged sours right.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Avery Barrel-Aged Series 27 - Insula multos Collibus

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob:
Bottled. Aroma is dark malt and bourbon. Appearance is black with a tan head. Taste is dark fruit with bourbon and dark favors. Palate has some cherry, but mainly fruit. Overall, a good beer that deserves some respect and dignity. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber... Aroma is booze and dark fruit. Appearance is black with a tan head. Taste is sweet, dark malt, and booze with hints of toffee and caramel. Palate is a medium mouthfeel. Overall, a really well done beer. Very nice barreled beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Aroma is funky and has some over ripe fruit. Appearance is a hazy gold with a fizzy head. Taste starts fruit pulp and then lends itself to a sour and funky flavor. Palate is sour and light. Overall, an interesting sour beer. Makes me want to try the other versions and see what else is going on.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber bottle. Aroma is sweet, dark malt and oats. Appearance is black with a dark brown head. Taste is bitter dark malt that finishes with a very roasty flavor. Palate is dark and astringent. Overall, a very good oatmeal stout. Would like to try side by side wit da Boris.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber bottle. Aroma is hops. Appearance is a very carbonated gold with a frothy, white head. Taste is alcohol that is coverEd by the hops. Some paler malts are also in there. Palate is hop bitter with a heavier than normal for a pils mouthfeel. Overall, about what I would expect of a dry hopped imperial pils. I figured with it being a lagunitas, it would be way more hoppy and dank. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft. Aroma is hops and some fruit. Appearance is a clear copper with a white head. Taste is very sweet fruit up front with the hop bitter kicking in towards the end. Palate is a little hoppy. Overall, a decent beer. Would try it again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber. Aroma es green grapes/ white wine and Belgian yeast. Appearance is a hazy bronze with little head. Taste is grape with Belgian yeast. A hint of bubble gum, white wine dryness, dark fruit. Palate is dry and very sweet. Overall, a good beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Aroma is salt and lime with a hint of sour yeast. Appearance is a hazy bronze with a little white head. Taste is very salty with a hint towards sour and lime. Palate is sour like a weak margarita. Overall, it seems this beer is in front of its time. It tastes like a weak margarita at best, not enough sour. Good idea... Not enough to back it up.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft. Aroma is booze and some malt. Appearance is gold with a cream colored head. Taste is booze with a malty sweetness that leans towards barley wine. Palate is sweet with lots-o-booze. Overall, a good beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft. Aroma is sour and fruity. Appearance is a hazy gold with a little head. Taste is super dry and sour. Hints of oak and peaches. Palate is dry and sour. Overall, a great beer. One of the better sours I have ever had.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

review_blob:
12oz bottle. Aroma is roast, espresso, chocolate. Appearance is black with a tan head. Taste is dark roasty malt with coffee kicking in with some sweetness at the end. Palate is dry and dark. Overall, a great coffee stout. Would buy again fo sho.

review_blob:
Bomber bottle. Aroma is a muted hop that is some what sweet. Appearance is a hazy light bronze with a white head. Taste is muted hops with a creamy mouthfeel. Overall, a good beer. Long name, but still good.

review_blob:
Bomber bottle. Aroma is a lite saison yeast with a lemony citrus. Appearance is a hazy yellow with a frothy, white head. Taste is a very muted saison yeast flavor that finishes very effervescent and lemon citrus. Palate is pretty neutral for a saison. Overall, a very well done beer, but I do not really care for most saisons. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Aroma is dark fruit and booze. Appearance is a very dark brown with a tan head and some lacing. Taste is very dry and dark with a hint towards dates, bourbon, caramel, and vanilla. Palate is dark. Overall, a very interesting beer that I would like to try again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber bottle. Aroma is hoppy with a hint towards pine. Appearance is a clear brown with a off white head with some lacing. Taste is a dank hop with a almost honey tone of sweetness. Palate is hoppy. Overall, a very good beer. Glad I have another bottle!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Founders Backstage Series #13: reDANKulous Imperial Red IPA

review_blob:
Bomber bottle, 2015 version. Aroma is pumpkin spice and pumpkin. Appearance is a dark brown with a tan head. Taste is pumpkin spice with a gourd like earthiness. Palate is spicy with some dark malt. Overall, a decent pumpkin beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Aroma is vanilla and sugar, reminding me of a roasted marshmallow. Appearance is black with a tan head. Taste is very roasty and sweet. There is some vanilla as well with some raw malt. Palate is dry dark roast with sugar. Overall, a great stout. Glad I have another.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Aroma es hops. Appearance is a dark hazy gold with a nice creamy head. Taste is very malt balanced for a double ipa... Flavor is hoppy, but sweet and not over the top bitter. I imagine this beer is rated a little higher cause it is from bells, but it is still a very quality double iPa. Would buy again, fo sho.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Aroma is an almost piney hop. Taste is a dank hop that has a creamy mouthfeel. Good and very session able overall. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber bottle. Aroma is a citrus tangerine flavor, reminds me of a gose. Appearance is a hazy bronze with no head. Taste is very citrus, almost sour, with more than a hint of tangerine. The finish is very raw tangerine, maybe that is some of the wheat. Overall, an ok beer, but too much fruit for my taste. Would have liked more malt flavor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber bottle. Aroma is a standard up a plus some bretty funk. Appearance is a hazy bronze with a cream colored head. Taste is a slightly sour then malty iPa flavor. Palate is muddled and not clear. Overall, a decent shot at this mix, but not quite right. They should give it another (better) shot.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Aroma is a very resiny hop. Appearance is a slightly hazy bronze with no head. Taste is a sweet hop flavor that fades out fast. Not too boozy. Overall, very good for an iPa this strong.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber bottle. Aroma is unripe raspberry and Brett. Appearance is a clear, lighter bronze with little to no white head. Taste is raw raspberries with a sourness. Very well done. Plate is light and sour. Overall, a very well executed beer. Gives you just what they say they are giving you.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Aroma hints to citrus fruit with some sour funk. Appearance is a cloudy yellow. Taste is sour and dry with a tangerine flavor. Palate is sour and dry. Overall, a great sour. A very interesting beer fo sho.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Aroma is straight sour. Appearance is a murky bronze with no head, but a lot of carbonation. Taste taste is a mix of sour and earthy right up front that finishes sour with hints of blackberry. Plate is sour. Overall, a good sour. Would like to drink more.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Ranger Creek Small Batch Series No. 9

review_blob:
Bomber bottle. Aroma is fresh pear with hops. Appearance is a hazy bronze with loads of carbonation, giving it a way frothy cream colored head. Taste is dry and raw. Tastes like as unrippen pear. Palate is dry. Overall, decent pale ale, not like the rest. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft. Aroma is hopped with one of the "c" hops, I am guessing centennial. Appearance is a hazy as hell gold with a white head. Taste is a sweet hop that smoothes out and finishes resiny. Palate is a dank hop. Overall, a good, easy drinking double. Would buy again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft. Aroma is Belgian yeast. Appearance is a hazy brown with a creamy head. Taste is a dubbel but the yeast is not as in your face as the aroma indicated. Very dry finish. Overall, a good beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft. Aroma is tart raspberries. Appearance is a hazy red with a creamy white head. Taste is raw raspberries that rolls into an extreme sour tartness. Palate is very sour. Overall, a good sour. Would have enjoyed a little more sweetness to help balance all the sour, but still a good sour.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber bottle share. Aroma is Belgian and hops. Appearance is a hazy bronze with creamy head. Taste is a danker hop with some Belgian yeast, but not as much as most triples. Palate is a hoppy Belgian. Overall, a good twist on triples.

Bomber bottle. Aroma is pumpkin spice. Appearance is a hazy dark bronze with a cream colored head. Taste starts with a way funky flavor then the pumpkin spice kicking in. Palate is spicy. Overall, an off balance beer. The spice is good, but the other favors are not optimal.

Bomber bottle. Aroma es dark, toasty malt with a hint towards some dry sourness. Appearance is dark brown with a tan head. Taste is basically a wild stout. I know every bottle will be different, but this one has sour all over it with the stout flavor underneath the sour. Why even make a sour style of this beer when this one already exists. The early batches where amazing. Wtf? Palate is dry roasted malt and sour. Overall, a stout that makes me wonder what was wrong with the first batches.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz bottle. Aroma is sweet barley wine and booze. Appearance is a red/brown with a cream colored head. Taste is boozy with a certain sweetness of malt to it. Palate is sweet. Overall, a good mash up of beer and the hard stuff. Would buy again.

Bomber share. Aroma is raspberry jam. Appearance is a red-brown with a little head. Taste is tart raspberry. Palate is sour and sweet. Overall, a really good beer.
